    • withEnv

os module function wrappers than can work with both nimscript and regular target.os wrapper with more typesafe paths. Mostly taken from compiler pathutils and stdlib.

Types

AbsFile = distinct string
AbsDir = distinct string
AbsPath = AbsFile | AbsDir
RelFile = distinct string
RelDir = distinct string
RelPath = RelFile | RelDir
AnyPath = AbsFile | AbsDir | RelFile | RelDir
AnyDir = AbsDir | RelDir
AnyFile = AbsFile | RelFile

Consts

cbackend = true
CurDir = "."
ParDir = ".."
DirSep = '/'
AltSep = '/'
PathSep = ':'
ExeExts = [""]

Procs

proc getCurrentDir(): AbsDir {...}{.raises: [OSError], tags: [].}
Retrieves the current working directory. 
proc cwd(): AbsDir {...}{.raises: [OSError], tags: [].}
proc normalizePathEnd(path: var AnyPath; trailingSep = false): void
Ensures path has exactly 0 or 1 trailing DirSep, depending on trailingSep, and taking care of edge cases: it preservers whether a path is absolute or relative, and makes sure trailing sep is DirSep, not AltSep. Trailing /. are compressed, see examples. 
proc joinPath(head: AbsDir; tail: RelFile): AbsFile {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
proc joinPath(head: AbsDir; tail: RelDir | string): AbsDir

proc paramStr(i: int): string {...}{.raises: [], tags: [ReadIOEffect].}
Retrieves the i'th command line parameter. 
proc paramCount(): int {...}{.raises: [], tags: [ReadIOEffect].}
Retrieves the number of command line parameters. 
proc paramStrs(addBin: bool = false): seq[string] {...}{.raises: [], tags: [ReadIOEffect].}
Return sequence of command line parameters as strings. If addBin is failse (default) omit first parameter (which is a name/path of binary being called - most of the time you only need the parameters itself) 
proc getEnv(key: string; default = ""): string {...}{.raises: [], tags: [ReadEnvEffect].}
Retrieves the environment variable of name key. 
proc existsEnv(key: string): bool {...}{.raises: [], tags: [ReadEnvEffect].}
Checks for the existence of an environment variable named key. 
proc putEnv(key, val: string): void {...}{.raises: [OSError], tags: [WriteEnvEffect].}
Sets the value of the environment variable named key to val. 
proc setEnv(key, val: string): void {...}{.raises: [OSError], tags: [WriteEnvEffect].}
Sets the value of the environment variable named key to val. 
proc delEnv(key: string) {...}{.raises: [OSError], tags: [WriteEnvEffect].}
Deletes the environment variable named key. 
proc fileExists(filename: string | AnyFile): bool
Checks if the file exists. 
proc dirExists(dir: string | AnyDir): bool
Checks if the directory dir exists. 
proc existsFile(filename: string | AnyFile): bool
An alias for fileExists. 
proc existsDir(dir: string | AnyDir): bool
An alias for dirExists. 
proc toExe(filename: string): string {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
On Windows adds ".exe" to filename, else returns filename unmodified. 
proc toDll(filename: string): string {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
On Windows adds ".dll" to filename, on Posix produces "lib$filename.so". 
proc listDirs(dir: AnyDir): seq[AbsDir]
Lists all absolute paths for all subdirectories (non-recursively) in the directory dir. 
proc listFiles(dir: AnyDir): seq[AbsFile]
Lists all the files (non-recursively) in the directory dir. 
proc rmDir(dir: AnyDir; checkDir = false)
Removes the directory dir. 
proc rmFile(file: AnyFile)
Removes the file. 
proc mkDir(dir: AnyDir)
Creates the directory dir including all necessary subdirectories. If the directory already exists, no error is raised. 
proc mvFile(source, dest: AnyFile)
Moves the file from to to. 
proc mvDir(source, dest: AnyDir)
Moves the dir from to to. 
proc cpFile(source, dest: string | AnyFile)
Copies the file from to to. 
proc cpDir(source, dest: AnyDir)
Copies the dir from to to. 
proc cd(dir: AnyDir)
Changes the current directory. 
proc findExe(bin: string): AbsFile {...}{.raises: [OSError], tags: [ReadDirEffect,
    ReadEnvEffect, ReadIOEffect].}
Searches for bin in the current working directory and then in directories listed in the PATH environment variable. Returns "" if the exe cannot be found. 
proc `~`(path: string | RelDir): AbsDir
proc getNewTempDir(dir: string | AbsDir = getTempDir(); dirPatt: string = "XXXXXXXX"): AbsDir
Get name for new temporary directory

Changes the current directory temporarily. 
template withTempDir(clean: bool; body: untyped): untyped
Create temporary directory (not don't cd into it!), execute body and remove it afterwards if clean is true
